div1.head: l

div2.entryFree:
alphabetical letter l *
l — lanaA fiY baniY fulaAnK dimaA='N [We have a claim, upon the sons of such a one, to blood, lit. bloods]. (S in art. xbl.) ― -b2- lahu A^ano yafoEala ka*aA He shall have a right to do such a thing: see Eaqaba. ― -b3- raA^ayotu lahu bariyqFA I saw it to have a glistening: and samiEotu lahu SawotFA I heard him, or it, to have a sound proceeding from him, or it; or rather, I heard a sound attributable, or to be attributed, to him, or it; meaning, I heard him, or it, utter or produce, a sound; or I heard in consequence of it, &c. (see saTaEN). ― -b4- lahu ka*aA often means Such a thing appertains, or is attributable, to him, or it. ― -b5- maA lanaA A^al~aA nuqaAtila, in the Kur ii. 247, [i. e. A^ano laA,] means What object have we (A^aY~u garaDK lanaA) in (fiY) [that we should not fight? or, in our] not fighting? (Bd:) And maA lanaA A^al~aA natawak~ala EalaY A@ll~`hi, in the same, xiv. 15, means What excuse have we (A^aY~u Eu*orK lanaA) in (fiY) [that we should not rely upon God? or, in our] not relying upon God? (Bd.) maA lanaA A^ano laA nafoEala ka*aA [may be rendered What reason, or motive, have we that we should not do such a thing? or, in that, &c.? or in our not doing &c.? for] the original form of the phrase is maA lanaA fiY A^ano laA nafoEala ka*aA (Mugh, voce A^ano.) Often A^ano is omitted, but meant to be understood: you say also, maA laka tafoEalu ka*aA What reason, or motive, hast thou that thou dost such a thing? or what aileth thee &c.? It is often like maA baAluka. ― -b6- gar~ada biSawotK lahu DaEiyfK It (a bird) warbled with a feeble voice peculiar to it. ― -b7- maA liY walilobagi baEoDikumo EalaY baEoDi: see maA liY A^araAka tafoEalu ka*aA bagaY What hath happened to me that I see thee doing such a thing, or thus? See an ex. in conj. 3 of art. blw. ― -b8- maA laka bika*aA: see a verse cited in art. Elw. ― -b9- A^anaA lahaA I am for it; i. e., I am the man for it; meaning a war, or battle, HarobN, which is of the fem. gender. Often occurring in old Arabic stories. ― -b10- li in the sense of fiY: see Msb, voce Eid~apN. ― -b11- mano liY Who is, or will be, for me, as aider, or helper, or defender, or surely? For exs., see saboEN, and $abara, and A^afovaA^a. ― -b12- taEosFA lahu, and quboHaA lahu, and natonFA lahu, &c.: see the first word of each of these phrases. ― -b13- mano liY bika*aA: see bi (near the end of the paragraph): and see also above. ― -b14- li in the sense of baEod: see an ex. voce A^afoTara, and see other exs. in the Msb, art. fTr. ― -b15- li in the sense of baEoda, or mino waqoti: see gam~N. ― -b16- lilayolapK xalato When one night had passed; i. e. on the first day of the month: l in this case meaning Einoda. ― -b17- yaA lilofaliyqapi come with succour to the calamity: see filoqN. ― -b18- li in the sense of EalaY: see Kur xvii. 108-9, and xvii. 7, and xxxvii. 103: and see exs. voce fuwhN (last quarter). ― -b19- l in fadFY laka &c.: see art. fdY. ― -b20- la used as a corroborative, (see S in art. lwm,) after lawo and luwolaA the conditional A_ino, is sometimes difficult to express in English, except by emphasis in pronunciation; as in A^amaA A_in~ahu larajulN kariymN Verily, or now surely, he is a generous man. This ex. occurs voce A^amaA. ― -b21- la redundantly prefixed, for corroboration, to the k of comparison: see a verse of Tarafeh voce vinoYN; and another similar instance in the Mugh, art. l. ― -b22- laZarufa zayodN means How excellent, or elegant, in mind, manners, address, speech, person, or the like, is Zeyd! syn. maA A^aZorafahu: and lakaruma EamorNw How generous, &c., is Amr! syn. maA A^akoramahu. (Mugh.) ― -b23- laniEoma huwa Excellent indeed is he, or it. ― -b24- maA kaAna liyafoEala means, accord. to the Koofees, maA kaAna yafoEalu; the l being redundant, to corroborate the negation: accord. to the Basrees, maA kaAna qaASidFA liA^ano yafoEala. (Mugh.) See an ex. voce EalaY as equivalent to fiY. ― -b25- la in sentences beginning with A_ino for A_in~a: see p. 107, cols. 2 and 3: and see conj. 3 in art, qrA^. ― -b26- l of inception (laAmu AlA_ibotidaA='i): see exs. of this voce A_in~a: and see De Sacy's Gr. Ar. n. 582, &c. ― -b27- la termed laAmu AljawaAbi is, I think, best rendered by Then; or in that case: see exs. voce A^amaA. ― -b28- la in laEamoru A@ll~`hi is [not a particle denoting swearing, but merely] a corroborative of the inchoative; the enunciative of which, i. e. qasamiY, or maA A^uqosimu bihi, is understood. (S, art. Emr.) ― -b29- yaA lazayodK, and yaAla zayodK, accord. to the Koofees, is a contraction of yaA A=la zayodK. (Mugh, letter l; and El-Ashmoonee on the Alfeeyeh, AlAstfAvp.) It seems that where the l is not connected with the word following it, yaAla is generally, if not always, for yaA A=la; and so sometimes when it is connected. See yaAla gudara, voce gaAdirN, and see EajabN. See also De Sacy's Gr. Ar., 2nd ed., i. 476, note.

laA * , the negative, does not necessarily restrict to the signification of future time a marfooa aor. following it: in a case of this kind, maA is often substituted for it in the explanation of a phrase; as in the instance of laA yaEorifu hir~aA mino bir~K, in the TA, art. br; and the aor. is more properly rendered by the present than by the future. ― -b2- laA rajula qaAy^imN There is not any man standing: (Mugh:) but when the subst. and epithet are both simple words, and not separated, the latter may be used in three different ways; as in laA rajula Zariyfa and ZariyfFA and ZariyfN; otherwise it must be marfooa or mansoob, but not mebnee: this relates to lA used linafoYi Aljinosi. (Ibn-'Akeel, p. 165.) ― -b3- lA, also, Lest. See rakabahu. ― -b4- [laA lahu walaA Ealayohi There is nothing due to him, nor anything to be demanded of him. (Thus I have rendered this phrase, voce malasaY, in three places.) For] when lA is a general negative, the context renders it allowable to suppress its subject, as in laA Ealayoka, for laA baA^osa Ealayoka; and sometimes the predicate, when known, is suppressed, as in laA baA^osa. (Msb.) ― -b5- laA$a, for laA $aYo'a: see art. lw$. ― -b6- kalaA walaA [As the time occupied in saying laA walaA]. See an ex. in the TA, voce lwo*aAn. ― -b7- laA walaA Olive-oil: in allusion to the words in the Kur xxiv. 35, occurring in a trad. ― -b8-
laA yaqoraA^i, as a prohibition, and lA yaqoraA^u as an enunciative with the same meaning: see a trad. thus commencing in the Jámi' es-Sagheer: and see the Kur lvi. 78: and see an ex. voce rahonN. ― -b9- laA A^agar~u walaA bahiymN: see bahiymN. ― -b10- laA in a case of pausation pronounced laA^o: see art. A (near the end).

1 laA^aka *
He sent. (Msb in art. Alk.) ― -b2- A^alikoniY A_ilayohi; and A^alakotuhu: see art. Alk.
10 AisotaloA^aka * : see AstA^lk.
maloA^akN * : see maA^olakN.
laA^~lN * : see art. lA^.
liy^aAlapN * : see art. lA^.

1 law^uma *
He was base, base-born, low, ignoble, ungenerous, mean, sordid; (S:) contr. of karuma. (K.) See lay^iymN. ― -b2- laA^ama: see also ZaAhara.

3 laA='amotu bayona Alqawomi * , inf. n. mulaA='amapN, I reconciled the people, (S, Msb,) and brought them together. (S.) ― -b2- laA='amahu He was suited to him as a companion: see 5 in art. zwY. ― -b3- laA='amahu It (food, T, and an affair, M) suited him. (T, M.) ― -b4- And i. q. laA zamahu. (T.) ― -b5- And It coalesced, or united, with it.

8 AilotaA^ama *
It (a wound, and a crack) became coalesced, consolidated, closed, or closed up: (S:) it (a hole, or rent,) became repaired. (Msb.) ― -b2- AilotaA^amaA They (two things) agreed together, or became consistent. (S, Msb.) ― -b3- AilotaA^ama It drew, and stuck, together; coalesced; or consolidated. (Mgh.)
luw^omapN * : see luw^amapN.

luw^amapN * , (S, K,) or ↓ luw^omapN, (M, IB,) The whole apparatus, or gear, of the plough: (AHn, S, M, K:) or its iron [or share] and its wooden parts: (M:) or the sin~ap [or ploughshare] with which the earth is ploughed up, and which, when upon the plough, is termed EiyaAnN, pl. Eyn: (IAar, TA:) the sik~ap. (IB, TA.) See EiyaAnN.
rajulN jamiyEu All~aA^omapi * : see jamiyEN.

lay^iymN *
Mean; ungenerous; sordid; ignoble; base; base-born; contr. of kariymN. (K, &c.) See law^uma.
A^alaAy^imu AlA^umuwri * : see madaAq~.

A^aloA^amu *
Baser, and basest; &c.: see an ex. voce zakomapN.

AlmulaA='amapu *
i. q. AlAijotimaAEu: see Aisotalama.

riy$N mutalaAy^imN *
i. q.. luw^aAmN. See lafata.

baEodu laA^oYK *
After difficulty, &c. (Lth, TA.) See an ex. cited voce bay~ana. ― -b2- laA^oyFA With difficulty, trouble, labour, or exertion.
mulab~asN * pl. mulab~asaAt Sugared almonds, &c.
laboEFA * : see DaboEN.
EabiqN labiqN * and EabiqapN labiqapN: see EabiqN.
labiqN baAlqaluwbi * : see Ea*iqN.
labaAqapN * : see A_inaAqapN in art. Anq.
1 labakahu * is like rabakahu.
labakapN * : see EabakapN.
labolaAbN * : see HilibolaAbN or HilobaAbN.

banaAtu labanK * [app. The small guts or intestines, in which originate the lacteals;] the intestines in which is the milk. (M, K.) See Hawy~apN, termed banaAtu All~abani. ― -b2- labanapN [n. un. of labanN]. (Az, in TA, art. xrs.)

labinN *
Bricks; (T, S, M, Mgh, Msb, K;) crude, or unburnt, bricks. (MA.)
libonapN * : see baniyqapN.

lubaAnN * [The frankincense-tree] is a tree of the kind called EiDaAh, having a fruit resembling the pistachio-nut, and a resin like the kunodur, [which is said in the S and TA to be the same as the lubaAn,] when it concretes: (O and TA in art. syE:) it is also, and more commonly, applied to the resin itself, i. e. frankincense, or olibanum: the tree that produces it is now known to be of the genus Boswellia, found in Hadramowt and other parts of Southern Arabia, and also in the opposite (eastern) region of Africa, and in India: it was formerly erroneously supposed to be the Juniperus Lycia. ― -b2- HaSaY lubaAnK: see K, voce EasalN; and see art. HSY.
libaAnN * The sucking of milk or of the breast: (S, Msb, K:) see an ex. in a verse of El-Aashà cited voce A^asoHamu: and see 1 in art. g*w.
labuwnN * : see laquwHN and bakorN. ― -b2- A_ibonu labuwnK A male camel that has entered upon his third year: (S, Mgh, K:) or entering upon his third year: (Msb:) or in his second year. (K.)

Easalu All~ubonaY *
i. q. AlmayoEapu [now applied to Storax, or styrax] sometimes used for fumigation. (TA.) See art. Esl.
lubaAnapN magoribiy~apN * : see farobayuwnN.

labaniy~apN *
Food made with milk: so in modern Arabic: see xaTiyfapN.
lubayonapN * [A little milk: dim. of labanapN, n. un. of labanN]: see ravaA^a.

milobanN *
A thing like the miHomal, upon which bricks (labin) are carried from place to place. (M.) See fatoxaA='u.
2 lab~aAhu * [inf. n. talobiyapN] He said to him lab~ayok. (MA.)
lab~ayoka * , and lab~ayohi, and lab~aYo yadayoka: see art. lb.
livapN * The gum. See art. lwv.

luvofapN * The changing, in pronunciation, s into v, or r into g or l, (S, K, Msb,) and the like: (Msb:) or, one letter into another. (Az, in Msb, K.) Also, A word mispronounced; as when a word is said to be lugapN A^awo luvofapN a dialectal variant or a word mispronounced.

1 lavamati AlHijaArapu xuf~a AlbaEiyri *
The stones wounded the camel's foot, and made it bleed. (S.) ― -b2- lavamato. She muffled herself with a livaAm. (K.)

livaAmN *
A kind of muffler for the mouth. (K.)
lavFY * : see Eabiybap.
AlHuruwfu All~itawiy~apu * [The gingival letters:] these are * v, and Z. (TA, commencement of bAb AlvA'.)

1 laj fiY AlA^amori *
He kept, attended, or applied himself, constantly, perseveringly, or assiduously, to the thing; he was persevering, or assiduous, in the affair. (Msb.)
lajafo * : see qiSaAbN.

4 A^alojama *
He bridled a beast; agreeably with an explanation in the K: and sometimes he bitted him; as expl. in the Msb.
5 talaj~amato * : see 10 in art. vfr.
lujamN * : see lujomapN.

lujomapN * and ↓ lijaAmN A thing from which one augurs evil; an omen, or a bodement, of evil: because it refrains one from a thing that he wants. (A, art. ETs.) ↓ lujamN, which is originally the plural of both, is also used as a sing. (A, ibid, where see an ex.) See EaTasa and EaTuwsN.

lijaAmN * [A bit; i. e., the iron appurtenances of a bridle]. To the ljAm belong pieces of iron which are fastened one to another; as the EiDaAdataAni, and the misoHal, and the faA^os and its extremities of iron. (Az, in TA, voce qayoqabN.) The above explanation is incomplete: it means the bridle, or headstall and reins, with the bit and other appurtenances; like its Persian original, likaAmo: see qar~aTa. It signifies The piece of iron in the mouth of the horse: thus, by extension, applied to this with its thongs, or straps, and apparatus: it comprises the $akiymap, which is the transverse piece of iron in the mouth; and the faA^os, which is the piece of iron standing up in the mouth; and the misoHal, which is the iron beneath the Hanak; and the xuT~aAfaAni, which are two bent pieces of iron in the misoHal and the $kymp, on the right and left; and the faraA$ataAni, which are two pieces of iron wherewith are fastened the extremities of the Ei*aAraAni; and the Hakamap, which is the ring surrounding the marosain and the Hanak, of silver or iron or thong. (IDrd, in his Book on the Saddle and Bridle.) -A2- See lujomahN.
1 lajina * : see laji*a.
5 talaj~ana Aln~abaAtu * : see talaz~aja.
laHoZN * : see EayorN.
liHaAfN * : see what follows.

miloHafapN *
A mulaA='ap that is sumuT [not lined, nor stuffed]: if lined or stuffed, the vulgar also call it by this name, but the Arabs do not know this: (L, TA:) and the same applies to the ↓ liHaAf: Az says, that liHaAfN and miloHafN mean the same: like A_izaArN and miy^ozarN, and qiraAmN and miqoramN; and sometimes one says miqoramapN and miloHafapN; and it is the same whether the garment be sumuT or lined. (TA.) He says also, [in another place,] that the Arabs apply the terms ↓ liHaAfN and miloHafapN to A night-wrapper (A_izaAru layoli) if it be TaAqN waAHidN [a single piece of stuff; i. e. not double, not lined nor faced, nor stuffed]. (TA in art. smT.) ― -b2- See A_izaAzN.

1 laHiqahu * and laHiqa bihi and ↓ A^aloHaqahu He reached him; overtook him; or came up with him. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b2- laHiqahu It (grief, &c.) overtook him; or ensued to him. ― -b3- Also, and laHiqa bihi He overtook him; came up with him. ― -b4- laHiqa bihi He became, or made himself, on a par, or as though on a par, with him. See an ex. voce tawaH~a$a. ― -b5- It became adjoined, or annexed, to it. ― -b6- ↓ luwHka It was firmly, or strongly, compacted or coherent or knit together: and its several parts were inserted one into another. (TA.) ― -b7- laHiqahu Alv~amanu, inf. n. luHuwqN, [i. q. A^adorakahu, i. e. The payment of] the price was, or became, obligatory on him. (Msb.) ― -b8- laHiqato quw~atuhu wasin~uhu: see the last sentence of art. Ewn. ― -b9- laHiqahu has for its inf. n. luHuwqN as well as laHaAqN. (TA.)
3 laAoHaqa see 1.

4 A^aloHaqahu bihi *
He made him to reach, overtake, or come up with, him; (S, Msb, * K; *) or to follow him. (Msb.) He made it (a punishment) to [overtake him, or] befall him. (Msb.) He removed him to it; namely, a place; lit., caused him to reach it: see an ex. voce xaAfiqN. ― -b2- He affiliated him to him; announced him to be his son, because of a mutual likeness. (Msb.) ― -b3- A^aloHaqahu bihi He classed him, as an adjunct, with him; put him on a par with him; or made him to be as though on a par with him; See two exs. voce laATa, in art. lyT. ― -b4- See 1.

6 talaA Haqati AlmaTaAyaA *
The saddle-camels overtook one another. (S, K.) talaA HaquwA The last of them overtook, or came up with, the first of them. (S, TA in art. drk.)

luHuwqN *
i. q. luzuwmN and luSuwqN. (TA)

laAHiqu AlA=TaAli *
Lean, or lank, in the sides. (Ham. p. 496.) laAHiqu AlbaToni Lank in the belly. (TA in art. rhf.)

A_iloHaAqN * The rendering a word quasi-coördinate to another word of which the radical letters are more in number than those of the former word. A letter which is added to a word for the purpose above mentioned. See A^alifu AlA_iloHaAqi and A^alifu Alt~akoviyri in art. A. ― -b2- Harofu A_iloHaAqK A letter of adjunction, or quasi-coördination.

muloHaqN * , pl. muloHaqaAtN, A word rendered quasiradically coördinate to another word of which the radical letters are more in number than those of the former word. ― -b2- muloHaqN biAlr~ubaAEiY~i A quasiquadriliteral-radical word. ― -b3- See A_iloHaAqN.

birawo*awonN mutalaAHikN *
i. q. mutaEaAwinN. (TA in art. Ewn.)

4 A^aloHama xaroqahu * [He closed up the hole thereof with a patch]; meaning a garment, or piece of cloth, and a skin, or hide. (TA in art. rqE.) ― -b2- A_iloHaAmu AljiraAHaAti [The consolidating of wounds]. (K in art. sbE.) -A2- A^aloHamahu EiroDahu (tropical:) He empowered him to revile, vilify, or censure, him: (S, K, TA:) he made his honour, or reputation, to be to him [as] a ↓ luHomap [or hawk's portion of the quarry]. (Har, p. 392.) ― -b2- A^aloHimo maA A^asodayota: see A^asodaY.

6 talaAHama *
It was joined, or knit, together. See K, voce mazofuwrN.

8 AilotaHama *
It coalesced, consolidated, closed up, or became closely united. (TA.)
tamorN lahu laHomN * [Dates having flesh]. (Msb in art. H$f.) ― -b2- laHomN: see variydN, last sentence.
$aHimN laHimN * : see maHiDN and $aHimN.
laHomapN * and ↓ luHomapN The woof; or the threads that are woven into the sadaY. or warp, of a piece of cloth. (Msb, &c.)
luHomapN * : see 4, and laHomapN. ― -b2- luHomapN $aAbikapN: see mu$otabikN.

laH~aAmN *
A butcher. (Fr, TA in art. sTr.)

malaAHimu Alfaroji * (K) The narrow, or strait, parts of the pudendum muliebre: (TA:) or rather, the fleshy parts thereof: the sing. maloHamapN signifying, accord. to analogy, a place of much flesh: see biTaAnN.
AlmulotaHimapN * [The tunica albuginea, or white of the eye: so in the present day]. (K, voce sabalN.)
$aj~apN mutalaAHimapN * : see $aj~apN, and baAzilapN (voce baAzilN).

1 laHana *
He erred in speech; spoke incorrectly. (Msb.) ― -b2- laHana lahu He said to him something which he (the latter) understood, but which was unintelligible to others: (Az, S, Msb, K:) he intimated to him something which he (the latter) alone understood.

3 laAHanahumo *
i. q. faATanahumo. (S, K.) See an ex. voce jaAmiEN; and see my explanations of mufaATanapN.

laHonN * The meaning of speech; its intended sense or import: (S, K, TA:) its intent: (TA:) [it is direct: and also indirect:] an indication thereof whereby the person addressed is made to understand one's intent; so says Az (Msb: [and the like is said in the TA on the authority of AHeyth:]) an oblique, or ambiguous, mode of speech: (Msb:) an inclining of speech to obliqueness, or ambiguity, and equivocal allusion. (Bd, in xlvii. 32.) ― -b2- A barbarism, an incorrect word. ― -b3- Earafotuhu fiY laHoni kalaAmihi and fY naHowi klAmh. and fY miEoraADi klAmh signify the same. (Msb in art. ErD.) See the last of these voce EaruwDN. ― -b4- laHonN A modulated sound; expl. as being mina AlA^aSowaAti AlmaSuwgapi AlmawoDuwEapi: pl. A^aloHaAnN and luHuwnN. (K.) You say, A^aloHaAnu AlA^agaAniY [The modulated sounds of songs]. (Mgh.)
1 luHiYa * : see a verse cited voce xaTaba. ― -b2- laHaAhu A@ll~`hu: see $araAhu.
5 talaH~aY * , (S, Mgh,) and tlH~Y biEimaAmatihi, (TA, art. Ejr,) He wound a part of his turban under his lower jaw: (S, Mgh:) as also taHan~aka, q. v.
8 AilotaHayotu All~aHoma Eani AlEaZomi * [I peeled off the flesh from the bone]. (O, K, in art. slq.)

laHoYN * [not laHFY] The jaw-bone; (Mgh, Msb;) either upper or lower: (Msb:) and, in a man, (Msb,) the part on which the beard grows. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b2- And sometimes Either lateral portion of the lower jaw: see *aqanN, and Alfaniyku.
liHoyapu Alt~ayosi * : see viylN. ― -b2- liHoyapN is sometimes, by a synecdoche, put for the whole person: see a verse cited voce xunovN.
masoHu All~uiHaY * : see Eaq~a biAls~ahomi.

liHaA='N *
Bark; and in particular the bark of a plant, or of a tree, of which ropes &c. are made. ― -b2- The liHaA=' of the date is [its Pulp, pulpy pericarp, or flesh; i. e.] the part that clothes the nawaAp [or stone]. (TA.) ― -b3- liHaA='u AlEinabi [The skin of grapes]. (TA in art. $Hm.)
lawaAHiY Al$~ayobi * , for lawaAy^iHu Al$yb, q. v.

luxoquwqN * [A sort of trench, or channel, made by water, which has worn and undermined its sides;] a place in which water flows, having sides worn and undermined thereby, and hollowed in the form of the river, or river-bed: pl. laxaAqiyqu. (ISh, TA.)

A^aloxaY *
Distorted in the mouth. (CK; L, art. lx, but written AlxA='.)
mulad~amN * A garment, or piece of cloth, patched, or pieced; or patched, or pieced, in several places; like murad~amN. (Lth, T, in art. rdm.)

entryFree.hi: Supple; lithe; limber; limp; pliant; pliable; flexible.

div2.entryFree:
mino laduno *
From the time of: see a verse cited in art. EY, conj. 4. ― -b2- h`*aA AlA^amoru mino ladunohu i. q. mino qibalihi, q. v. (Lth in TA, in art. qbl.)
1 la*aEa All~isaAna * [It burned the tongue; was acrid]. (S, Msb, art. Hrf; &c.)
la*oEu Albarodi * [The hurting, or paining, of cold]. (S, O, K, voce $afiyfN.)

3 laAz~ahu *
i. q. DaAyaqahu. (TA, voce *aAqanahu.)

laz~N *
i. q. zurofiynN. (A, K.) In the CK, walazazN qayonN is a mistake for waAll~az~u Alz~urofiynu.
lizoqahu * and biluziqihi Close by his, or its, side.

1 lazimahu *
It necessarily, or inseparably, belonged, or pertained, or it clave, or adhered, to him, or it; as also lazima lahu: it (disgrace, &c.) attached to him. ― -b2- lazimahu A^amoru fulaAnK The management of the affair, or affairs, of such a one was, or became, incumbent, or obligatory, upon him. ― -b3- lazima $ayoy^FA He kept close, clave, clave fast, clung, or held fast, to anything. (S, K, &c.) And hence, He preserved a thing: see qaniYa. ― -b4- See 3. ― -b5- lazma Algariyma, and lazima bihi, and ↓ laAzamahu, He adhered, kept, clave, clung, or held fast, to the debtor. (Msb.) ― -b6- lazima bayotahu He kept, or clave, to his house or tent; did not quit it; was not found elsewhere. (Kull, p. 318.) ― -b7- lazimahu AlmaAlu The [paying of the] money &c. behoved him, lay on him, was incumbent on him, or obligatory on him. (Msb.)

3 laAzamahu *
He kept, confined himself, clave, clung, or held fast, to him, or it: as also ↓ lazimahu: he held on, or continued, it. See 1.

4 A^alozamahu $ayoy^FA * signifies He necessitated him, or obliged him, to do, and to pay, &c.; or to suffer, or endure, a thing: and hence, said of God, He decreed; or appointed, or ordained, to him a thing. And He made him to cleave to a thing; and he made a thing to cleave to him. See jadaEa. ― -b2- A^ulozima $ayoy^FA laA yufaAriquhu [He was made to cleave to a thing, not quitting it]. (K.) ― -b3- A^alozamahu All~`hu Al$~ar~a May God make evil to cleave to him: or, to attend him constantly: or decree evil to him. ― -b4- A^alozamanaAhu TaAy^irahu fiY Eunuqihi, (Kur xvii. 14,) We have decreed to him his happiness or his misery, foreseeing that he would be obedient, or disobedient: (AM, in TA, art. Tyr:) or we have made his works and what is decreed to him to cleave to him like the Tawoq upon his neck. (Bd.) ― -b5- A^alozamahu Albay~inapa He compelled him, or constrained him, to accept, or admit, the evidence, or proof. (Jel xi. 30.) ― -b6- A^alozamahu AlmaAla He obliged him to pay the money &c. A^alozamahu AlEamala He obliged him to do the deed. (Msb.) ― -b7- A^alozamotuhu Ald~anoba, and AlHaq~a: see zak~a. ― -b8- A^alozimo naEolayoka qadamayoka [Keep thou thy sandals upon thy feet]. (From a trad. in the Jámi' es- Sagheer.)

8 Ailotazama *
He took upon himself an affair. (KL.) You say, Ailotazamahu He took it upon himself; charged himself with it; obliged himself to do it; became, or made himself, answerable for it by an inseparable obligation: see baA='a. ― -b2- Ailotazamotu baAlmaAli i. q. A^alozamotu bihi nafosiY, and takaf~alotu
baha, accord. to IAmb, or taHam~alotu bihi, accord. to AZ; (Msb in art. kfl;) I made myself answerable, responsible or accountable, by an inseparable obligation, for the property: see Damina. ― -b3- Ailotazama AlmaAla, and AlEamala, He obliged himself, or took upon himself the obligation, to pay the money &c., and to do the deed. (Msb.) ― -b4- Ailotazamahu He kept, or restricted himself, to it; i. e. an action, or usage, &c. ― -b5- And It was, or became, necessary for him, or obligatory upon him, to do it, or pay it, &c.; or to suffer it, or endure it. ― -b6- dalafa liA@lotizaAmiY He hastened to take me by the hand and embrace me: see dalafa. ― -b7- AilotizaAmN i. q. luzuwmu maA laA yalozamu: see below.

10 Aisotalozamahu *
It necessarily required it or involved it.
lazuwmN * One who keeps, cleaves, clings, or holds fast, much, or habitually, li$aYo'K to a thing: see an ex. in the Ham, p. 238, line 21.

luzuwmu maA laA yalozamu *
The imposing upon one's self what is not indispensable; or adhering to a mode of construction that is not necessarily to be followed: as in the following instance in the xuTobap of the Kámoos: wabalaguwA mina AlomaqaASidi qaASiyatahaA wamalakuwA mina AlmaHaAsini naASiyatahaA.

laAzimN *
Keeping, keeping close, cleaving, &c.; tenacious: and pertinacious. ― -b2- laAzimN A thing inseparable from another thing: pl. lawaAzimu. (TA.) Such as cleaves fast; inseparable: as an epthet. ― -b3- A_isomN laAzimN: see jamoEN, as signifying “ a plural. ” ― -b4- lawaAzimu Necessary, or inseparable, adjuncts, accompaniments, consequences, or results.
A^alozamu * as syn. with A^aqonaY in the prov. xalaAw^uka A^aqonaY liHayaAy^ika means Most preservative: see that prov. in art. xlw, and see qaniYa AlHayaA='a, and lazima $ayoy^FA.
lazonN * : see A^asolafa.
lusolusN * : see sulosulN.
laisolaisapN * : see salosalapN.
mulasolasN * : see musal~asN and musalosalN.

lasanN *
Chasteness, or perspicuity, or clearness, of speech, (S, Msb, K,) and eloquence; (Msb;) i. q. bayaAnN: or, as some say, the quality of speaking well: and chasteness, or perspicuity, or eloquence, of speech, and sharpness of tongue. (TA.)

lisaAnN * of a sandal, The thing (hanap) projecting in the fore part thereof. (TA.) See misoradN. ― -b2- lisaAnN The tongue [or cock] of a balance: see minojamN in the S and K. ― -b3- lisaAnN In formation, news, or tidings; syn. xabarN. (S in art. Elw.) See a verse cited voce EulowN.
talas~unN * : see xaliy~apN, voce xaliY~N
mulas~anN * , (S,) or with p, (K,) A sandal long and slender, like the form of the tongue: (S, K:) or having the extremity of its fore part like the extremity of the tongue. (TA.)

muloSaqN *
i. q. daEiY~N (TA;) as also ↓ mulaS~aqN (TA in art. lsq) and mulas~aqN: (K, and TA in that art.:) or [a consociated alien;] one residing among a tribe of which he is not a member by lineage. (TA.)
mulaS~aqN * : see muloSaqN.
liToliTN * : see daluwqN. ― -b2- liToliTN A she-camel far advanced in age, and having lost her teeth. (T, in L, voce kuHokuHN.)

miloTaAsN *
A pickaxe. (TA.)

1 laTufa *
It (a thing) was small, or little; (S, Msb, K, KL;) and slender, thin, or fine: (K, KL:) and elegant, or graceful. (KL.)

2 laT~afa *
It (a medicine) acted as an attenuant, and as an emollient. ― -b2- laT~afahu, inf. n. taloTiyfN, [He made it slender]. (A, and K, art. H$r; &c.)

3 laATafa *
He caressed; treated with blandishment; soothed; coaxed; wheedled; cajoled: i. q. baAr~ahu. (S, K.) ― -b2- laATafahu also signifies He spoke softly, gently, or blandly, to him. (TA.) He acted in a good manner with him: (KL:) manifested goodness towards him: (PS:) he acted towards him with goodness: and he did so, experiencing from him the same: (TK:) or rather, as syn. with baAr~ahu, he behaved towards him with goodness and affection and gentleness, and regard for his circumstances; or did so, experiencing from him the same behaviour.

4 A^aloTafahu *
He gave him a gift or present. (TA.) ― -b2- He showed him kindness, or goodness, and affection and gentleness, and regard for his circumstances, bika*aA [by such a thing, or such an action, &c.]. (S, K, TA.) Often occurring in the latter sense: but A^aloTafaha bika*aA, expl. in the S and K by bar~ahu bihi, may mean He presented him with such a thing; like waSalahu bihi. ― -b3- See A^axolaTahu.

5 talaT~afa liloA^amori *
i. q. taraf~aqa: (S:) see Tab~a. ― -b2- I. q. takal~afa All~uTofa. (Bd xviii. 18.) ― -b3- talaT~afa bihi i. q. taraf~aqa. (Mgh in art. rfq.)

luTofN *
Gentleness: graciousness; courtesy; civility: (S, &c.:) see rifoqN: and delicacy of flavour, &c.

laTafN *
A gift, or present: pl. A^aloTaAfN. (MA.) ― -b2- See laTafpN.

laTafapN *
A present; i. e. a thing sent to another in token of courtesy or honour; syn. hadiy~apN; (S, K;) as also ↓ laTafN, as stated by Z and others: pl. of the latter A^aloTaAfN. (TA.)

laTiyfN *
Gentle, gracious, courteous, or benignant: and also subtle; knowing with respect to the subtilties, niceties, abstrusities, or obscurities, of things, affairs, or cases: in both of these senses often applied to a man. And Refined in manners, &c. ― -b2- Obscure, recondite, or abstruse, language. (Kull.) ― -b3- See Ham, p. 455. ― -b4- Applied to a medicine, &c., Delicate: see sawosanN.

laTiyfapN *
A nice, subtile, subtilely excogitated, quaint, facetious, or witty, saying, expression, or allusion; a witticism; a quaint conceit. ― -b2- [A nicety of language;] any indication of subtile meaning, apparent to the understanding, but not to be expressed; as [matters of] the sciences of taste (Euluwm AlA^adowaAq). (KT.)

AlA_iloTaAfu *
Self-pollution, by a woman: see jalada Eumayorapa in art. jld.

2 laT~ama *
He slapped much, or violently. See Tal~ama, and see K, voce mulax~abN.
laTomapN * : see naTiyHN.
laTiymN * : see naTiyHN. ― -b2- laTiymN A small camel. (TA, voce EasojadN.) ― -b3- laTiymapN see zawomalapN. ― -b4- Small weaned camels. (TA in art. Esjd.)
luEoTapN * : see EuloTapN, in two places.

1 laEiqa *
He licked (S, K, TA) his fingers: (TA:) he ate a thing with his finger [by taking it up therewith]. (Msb.)
miloEaqapN * [A spoon; vulgo maEolaqap;] a well-known instrument. (Msb.)

laEal~a * [May-be; perhaps]; a word denoting hope and fear. (K.) It governs the subject in the accus. case, and the predicate in the nom. See Ibn-'Akeel, ed. of Dieterici, p. 90; and see layota. ― -b2- laEal~a, in its original and general acceptation, expresses hope; but in the word of God it [often] expresses certainty, and may be rendered Verily. (Jel, ii. 19.)
luEonapN * A man who is much cursed. (TA in art. xdE.)
laEiynN * The base, or lower part, of a raceme of a palm-tree. (TA in art. Ehn.)
laEFA * , said to a camel when it stumbles: see taEosFA, voce taEasa: and see the first paragraph of art. Ewl, last sentence but one.

laEowapN *
A hunting bitch. (L, art. Eqd.)

3 laAga*ahu *
i. q. DaAyaqahu. (TA, voce *aAqanahu.)
lugaAmN * : see an ex. in a verse cited voce tarag~ama.
lugonuwnN * The sides, or adjacent parts, (AlnawaAHiY) of the lahaAp, impending (mu$orifap) over the Haloq [or throat]; as also lagaAniynN: (JK:) see gunodubapN, and lugodN.
lugonuwnapN * : see gunodubapN.

3 laAgaAhu *
He jested, or joked, with him; inf. n. mulaAgaApN. (A, TA.) You say, laAgaAhu fiY AlbayoEi. (A, TA, art. kys.)
lagowN * , applied to speech, &c., Nought; of no account; (M, K;) unprofitable. (M.) ― -b2- Alyamiynu All~agowu: see KT, voce yamiynN.

All~ugapu *
The genuine language of the Arabs; which is the classical language.

lugawiY~N *
Of, or relating to, the genuine language of the Arabs. maEonFY lugawiY~N A genuine lexicological meaning.

lugay~apN *
A word of weak authority. (TA, voce jiraAb, et passim.)
laAgK * : see maAy^irN.

1 laf~a *
He folded, or rather wrapped; folded up, or rather wrapped up, or rolled up, a thing in another thing. ― -b2- laf~a AlEaduw~a [app. He involved the enemy (in difficulty), or entangled him:] said with reference to war, and excellence of judgment, and knowledge of the case of the enemy, and the subduing him, with the infliction of many wounds. (L, in TA, voce Eamatahu.) But see Eamata.
5 talaf~a3a see 8.

8 Ailotaf~a *
It (herbage) tangled; became confused, and caught, one part to another: (Msb:) or became luxuriant, or abundant; (S;) it (a collection of trees) became luxuriant, or abundant, and close together: (AHn:) [or thickly intermixed:] it (a thing) became collected together, and dense; (TA:) best rendered tangled, or luxuriant, or abundant and dense. ― -b2- Ailotaf~a and ↓ talofaf~a He wrapped, or enwrapped, himself in, or with, a garment; (KL, PS;) i. q. Ai$otamala. (Msb.) ― -b3- Ailotaf~a wajohu AlgulaAmi means Ait~aSalato liHoyatuhu [i. e. The face of the young man became continuous, or uninterrupted, in its beard]. (TA.) ― -b4- Ailotaf~a It (an affair) became complicated.

laf~N wna$orN * in rhetoric, [Complication and explication, involution and evolution; i. e., a construction in which two or more words are mentioned, and, after them, two or more other words, as epithets, &c., referring to the former. lf~ wn$r murat~abN, Involution and evolution regularly disposed, is when the order of the latter words agrees with that of those to which they refer. lf~ wn$r maEokuwsN, or mu$aw~a$N, Involved, or disordered, involution and evolution, is when the order of the latter words is contrary to that of those to which they refer]. (TA, passim.) See Har, p. 383.

luf~apN *
i. q. luqomapN: see Suf~apN, last sentence.

laf~aA='u *
A thick thigh: see a verse voce tasaAhamuwA.
fulaAnN mino lafiyfinaA waDafiyfinaA * : see art. Df.

lifaAfapN *
A wrapper for the leg or foot &c. (S, K.) ― -b2- And A pericarp; a glume, and the like; an envelope: pl. lafaAy^ifu.

lafiyfapN *
A lock (xuSolapN) of hair. (S, voce xuSolapN.)
naAqapN mulaf~afapu Als~anaAmi * [A she-camel having the hump much enveloped with fur: see Ailotaf~a wjohu AlgulaAmi]. (Ibn-'Abbád, O, K, voce EulofuwfN q. v.)
mulotaf~u Alxaloqi * A man having a well-knit frame; compact in make. (L, art. msd.)
3 laAfaTahu * : see faAraTahu.
Alt~alaf~uEu * : see A$otamala.

1 lafaqa Alv~awoba *
He joined and sewed together, or put together and sewed, the two oblong pieces of cloth of the garment; (S, Msb, K;) and ↓ laf~aqa, inf. n. talofiyqN, signifies the same, and is more common; or has an intensive signification. (TA.) ― -b2- See also Har, pp. 253 and 254. ― -b3- ↓ talofiyqN The bringing, or putting, together. (KL.) And The making suitable, or conformable. (KL.) ― -b4- And The speaking, or telling, what is untrue, or false: (KL:) the embellishing [of speech] with lies. (Har, p. 254.) ― -b5- lafaqa He felled (a seam or garment).

2 laf~aqa see 1. ― -b2- laf~aqa bayona AlkalaAmi, (JK, voce ras~aga, &c.,) inf. n. talofiyqN, (K, voce tarosiygN, &c.,) He interlarded, or embellished, the speech, or discourse, with falsehood: see the pass. part. n. mulaf~aqapN: and see ras~aga, and rabiqa, and ram~aqa.
5 talaf~aqa bihi * : see taA^af~aqa.

lifoqaAni *
Two pieces which compose a mulaA='ap, (Mgh, Msb, TA, in art. ryT,) being joined together, (Mgh, TA, in that art.,) by sewing or the like. (TA in that art.)
lifaAqN * : see radiymapN.

A^aHaAdiyvu mulaf~aqapN *
Narrations, or stories, compounded, or combined, with falsehood; embel-lished [or interlarded] therewith: and put together. (MA, Har, p. 254.) ― -b2- $uq~apN mulaf~aqapN: see baiSyrapN.

lifaAmN *
A kind of woman's face-veil. See niqaAbN.

6 talaAfaAhu *
i. q. tadaArakahu [He repaired it; a meaning well known]; (S, Msb, K, TA;) namely, a short-coming; or failing, or falling short, of what
was requisite, or due; and an inconsistent act. (TA.) You say, h`*aA A^amorN laA yutalaAfaY [This is an affair that will not be repaired]. (TA.) And talaAfaY A^amorahumo biAlS~uloHi [He repaired their condition by peace, or reconciliation]. (EM, p. 117.) See daq~ahu
lafaApN * : see lfaAtN.

laq~N *
A fissure in a rock. (AA, in TA, voce vat~N.) ― -b2- laq~N baq~N and laqolaAqN baqobaAqN: see baqaAqN.

1 laqifahu *
He seized it, or took it quickly; (S, M, K;) namely, a thing thrown to him with the hand, or said to him. (M, TA.) See also last sentence of 1 in art. Hnk.

5 talaq~afahu mino famihi *
He caught it and retained it quickly, [i. e., what he said,] from his mouth. (TA.)

1 laqima luqomapF * , [aor.
laqama ,] inf. n. laqomN, (JK, MS,) [He gobbled a gobbet, or morsel, or mouthful, or] he swallowed the gobbet; and so ↓ AilotaqamahaA. (S.) laqimahu, aor.
laqama , (Msb, K, &c.,) inf. n. laqomN, (JK, MA, K, MS, JM,) or laqamN (Msb, [app. a mistake,]) He gobbled it; i. e., ate it quickly, (Msb, K, TA,) as also ↓ Ailotaqamahu, (Msb, [see above,]) and hastily; drew it with his mouth, and ate it quickly. (TA) ― -b2- laqima biyadihi He put morsels into his mouth (i. e., his own mouth) with his hand. See an ex. voce raqaEa. This seems to be the primary signification.

2 laq~amahu AlT~aEaAma * and A_iy~aAhu ↓ A^aloqamahu [He fed with the food by the mouthful; put it into his mouth by the mouthful]: (Msb:) or laq~amahu A_iy~aAhu and ↓ A^aloqamahu A_iy~aAhu he put a mouthful [of it] into his mouth. (TA.) And laq~amahu and ↓ A^aloqamahu [He fed him by the mouthful; put mouthfuls into his mouth]. (S.)

4 A^aloqama *
He put morsels into the mouth of [such a one]. See 2. ― -b2- A^aloqamotuhu AlHajara (assumed tropical:) I silenced him in an altercation. (Msb.) ― -b3- A^aloqamahu AlbiroTiyla; see the latter word.

5 talaq~ama All~uqomaha *
He swallowed the gobbet, or morsel, or mouthful, in a leisurely manner. (S, TA.)

8 A_ilotaqama see 1. ― -b2- Ailotaqama faAhaA fiY Alt~aqobiyli [He took her mouth within his lips in kissing]. (S in art. kEm.) Hence the verb signifies (assumed tropical:) It embraced, or clasped, a thing: see an instance, voce miHoSanN.

luqomapN *
A morsel, gobbet, or mouthful: what is [swallowed, or] eaten quickly, at once, of bread [&c.]; like as juroEapN signifies what is swallowed at once in drinking: (Msb:) or what is prepared to be [swallowed, or] eaten quickly [at once]. (K, TA.) ― -b2- luqomapN AlqaADiY, and luqomapu Alxaliyfapi: see zumaAwarodN, art. wrd; and muyas~arN.

luqayomaAtu AlqaADiY *
Same as luqamaAtu AlqADY.

3 laAqanahu *
i. q. DaAyaqahu. (TA voce *aAqanahu.)
laqanN * , arabicised from [the Persian] laqano [also written lakano]. A thing [or basin] resembling a Tasot, of Sufor [or brass]. (TA.) See A_ij~aAnahN.

1 laqiyahu *
He met him, or it. (Msb.) ― -b2- And He [met with, or] found him, or it. (Msb.) You say, taloqAhumN A^usodFA [Thou will find them lions]. (Mughnee, voce A_in~a.) See also ??. ― -b3- laqiytuhu and ↓ laAqayotuhu I came near to him, facing him: came to face his face. near to him (Ksh, in ii. 13.) ― -b4- laqiyahu bimakoruwhi (K in art. Hbh, &c.) He [encountered with him, or said to him, or did to him, a thing disliked, or hated: (TK in art. jbh:) like Astqblhu bimaA yakorahu.

2 laq~aAhu $ar~FA * [He made him to experience evil treatment]. (TA in art. jdE, voce jad~aEa.) See below; and see mulaq~FY. ― -b2- yulaq~awona taHiy~apF They shall be greeted with prayer for length of life, or everlasting existence. (Bd in xxv. 75.)

3 laAqaAhu * [He met him face to face; had an interview with him;] i. q. qaAbalahu. (TA.) See 1. ― -b2- laAqaY He experienced pain &c. See an ex. voce dabirN; and voce A=lN: like laqiYa, voce A=lN. ― -b3- laAqaY bayona TarafaY A_izaArihi wa$ad~ahu [He made the two ends of his AzAr to meet, and tied it]. (A, art. Hjz.)

4 A^aloqaAhu *
He threw it where he would find it. (Er-Rághib.) ― -b2- And hence, conventionally, He threw it in any way: (Er-Rághib:) he threw it on the ground: (Mgh:) [he put it:] A^aloqaYotu AnmataAEa EalaY Ald~aAb~api I put the goods upon the beast. (Msb.) ― -b3- A^aloqato waladahaA She cast her young one, or her young. ― -b4- A^aloqaY also signifies He let fall a thing, a curtain, &c. ― -b5- A^aloqayotu A_ilayohi xayorFA (assumed tropical:) I did good to him. (TA.) And A^aloqayotu A_ilayohi Almuwad~apa and baAlmawad~api (assumed tropical:) [I offered or tendered to him, or gave or granted him, love, or affection]. (TA.) ― -b6- A^aloqaY Ealayohi raxamatahu (assumed tropical:) [He made his love, &c., to fall, or light, upon him, i. e. he bestowed it upon him]. (K, TA in art. rxm. [See this and three similar exs. voce raxamN.]) ― -b7- A^aloqaY A_ilayohi Als~alaAma He offered to him salutation, or submission: see silomN. ― -b8- $araba maA A^uloqiYa A_ilayohi: see art. $rb. ― -b9- A^aloqayotu A_ilayohi Alqawola and baAlqawoli I told, or communicated, to him the saying. (Msb.) ― -b10- A^aloqY Ealayohi $araA$irahu: see art. $r. ― -b11- A^aloqaAhu Ealayohi He put it into his mind; he suggested it: AlqAh [thus used] is said of God and of the Devil. (Kull, p. 277, in explanation of AlfyD. [See 1 in art. fayoDu, last sentence but one.]) ― -b12- [And] He dictated it; (Msb;) namely, a writing to the writer. (Msb, in art. ml.) ― -b13- A^aloqaY A_ilaY~a sir~ahu [He revealed to me his secret]. (TA, art. sr.) ― -b14- laA A^uloqiY A_ilayohi baAlFA: see art. bwl. ― -b15- A^aloqaY binafosihi, said of night (All~ayolu): see rabaDa. ― -b16- A^aloqaY A_ilayohi kalaAmFA He addressed to him speech.

5 talaq~aAhu minohu *
He received it from him. (TA.) ― -b2- talaq~aY i. q. talaq~ana. (Bd in l. 16.)
8 AilotaqaY masolakaAhaA * [Her vagina and rectum met together in one, by the rending of the part between,] on the occasion of devirgination. (M, in art. Atm.)

10 AisotaloqaY *
He lay, syn. naAma, (K,) upon the back of his neck. (JK, S, K.) And It (any. thing) was [or lay] as though thrown down or extended. (T, JK, TA.)

laqFY *
Muscles of the flesh. (TA, art. Dyj.) ― -b2- laqFY baqFY: see baqaAqN.

liqaA='N * The facing a thing. [encountering it:] and meeting it, meeting with it, or finding it: and perceiving it by the sense, and by the sight. (Er-Rághib, TA.) ― -b2- liqaA='N: its predominant application is Encounter, i. e. conflict, fight, battle, or war. (Mgh.) ― -b3- yawomu All~iqaA='i The day of encounter in fight &c.
bayoEu A_iloqaA='i AlHajari * : see naAba*ahu, and art. lms.

wajadotu h`*aA mn tiloqaA='ika *
I experienced this from thee, or on thy part; syn. mino jihatika and mino qibalika. (Mgh in art. qbl.) h`*aA AlA^amoru mino tiloqaAy^ihi This thing, or affair, is from him; syn. mino Einodihi; as also mino qibalihi and mino ladunohu. (Lth, in TA in art. qbl.) ― -b2- taloqaA='a In the direction that meets or faces. (El-Khafájee, TA.) You say, tawaj~aha tiloqaA='a fulaAnK [He went towards such a one], and tiloqaA='a Aln~aAri [in the direction of, or towards, the fire]. (K.) And jlst tiloqaA='ahu I sat over against him, or opposite to him. (S.) And waqafa tiloqaA='a Albayoti He stopped facing the house. (Msb.)
― -b3- tiloqaA='u Alqibolapi [The direction of the Kibleh]. (M, K, voce A_imoAmN.) -A2- See bay~anahu.
malaAqiY Alfazoji * [pl. of maloqFY,] The narrow, or strait, parts of the pudendum muliebre. (TA in art. lHm.) ― -b2- A@lomalaAqiY The horizontal slabs in which is the aperture in a privy.

mulaq~FY *
Greeted: see bulahoniyapN, in art. blh.

1 lk~ahu *
He pushed him, or thrust him; like dak~ahu and Sak~ahu. (As, TA in art. dk.)

likaAkN *
A pressing, or crowding: see an ex. voce Eak~ahN.
lakozN * [inf. n. of lakazahu] i. q. TaEonN, like laz~N. (TA, art. lz.)

lukonapN *
An impotence, or impediment, or a difficulty, in speech or utterance; (Msb;) a barbarousness, or viciousness, and an impotence, or impediment, in speech: (S:) or the not speaking Arabic rightly, by reason of a barbarousness, or viciousness, in the tongue: (K:) or the interposing of [words of] a foreign language in one's speech. (Mbr, TA.) See tahotahapN; and EujomapN, with which it is syn.
l`kino * , with the n quiescent, has no government. ― -b2- It means But after a negative proposition: but not after an affirmative: see A_il~aA.

1 lam~a A@ll~`hu $aEavahu *
God rectified, or repaired, and consolidated, what was disorganized, disordered, or unsettled, of his affairs. (S.)

2 lam~ama *
He made a lim~ap of his hair. (Z, TA in art. jm.)

4 A^alam~a biAlqawomi *
He came to the people, and alighted at their abode as a guest. (Msb.) See A^aTaAfa. ― -b2- And hence, A^alam~a biAlmaEonaY (assumed tropical:) He knew the meaning. (Msb.) ― -b3- And A^alam~a baAl*~anobi (assumed tropical:) He committed the sin, or offence. (Msb.) ― -b4- And A^alam~a He, or it, visited covertly; (Ham, p. 23;) or in a light, slight, or hasty manner. (Idem, pp. 385 and 815.) It became near. (Msb.) ― -b5- It happened. (Ham, p. 385.) ― -b6- A^alam~a bihi He came to him. (Ham, p. 127.) ― -b7- I. q. zaArahu gib~FA; as also A^alam~a Ealayohi. (TA.)

8 Ailotam~a *
It was collected, accumulated. ― -b2- Altm~wA They collected themselves; congregated.

lamo * with an aor. following it is often to be rendered in English by the preterperfect: ex., lamo A^arahu mu*u yawomaAni I have not seen him for two days. ― -b2- lamo yaDoribo He did not beat. (S, &c.) See also lam~aA. ― -b3- A^alamo: see the latter half of art. A^alaA; and the former part of art. A^amaA. ― -b4- lam~aA as a particle of exception [is equivalent to our But; meaning both except and, after an oath or the like, only, or nothing more than; and] is put before a nominal proposition; as, A_ino kul~u nafosK lam~aA EalayohaA HaAfiZN [There is not any soul but over it is a guardian, (Kur lxxxvi. 4,)] accord. to those who pronounce the m with teshdeed: and before a verb which is literally, but not in meaning, a preterite; as in A^ano$uduka A@ll~`ha lam~aA fEalota [I conjure, or beg, or beseech, thee by God but that thou do such a thing], i. e. maA A^asoA^aluka A_al~aA fiEolaka [I do not ask of thee anything save thy doing such a thing]. (Mughnee.) See its syn. A_il~aA. In the Kur xxxviii. 13, accord. to one reading, it occurs before a verb which is a preterite literally and in meaning. ― -b5- lam~aA, accord. to Ibn-Málik, is syn. with A_i*o: [and sometimes, like A_i*o, it means Since, or because:] one may say, lam~aA A^akoramotaniY A^amosi A^akoramotuka Alyawoma: but this is said to mean lah~aA vabata Alyawoma A_ikoraAmuka liY A^amosi A^akoramotuka. (Mughnee.) See also an ex. voce razaqa. ― -b6- lam~aA yaDoribo He has not yet beaten. (S, &c.) See also lamo.

lamamN *
A slight insanity or diabolical possession; (Mgh, Msb:) a slight taint or infection of insanity. See TayofN.

lam~apN *
A touch, or somewhat [of a taint or an infection of insanity], from the jinn. (S, K.) See lamamN.

lim~apN *
Hair that descends below the lobe of the ear. (S, K.) But see waforapN: and see a tropical use of it in a verse of Kumeyt cited in art. Hf, p. 597 c.
milam~N * : see mivam~N.

mulim~apN *
A misfortune that befalls in the present world. (S.) See an ex. in a verse cited voce HajaA.
mulam~amN * A boy having a lim~ap. (IDrd, TA, voce mujam~amN.)

1 lamaEa *
It (lightning, &c.) shone; shone brightly; gleamed; glistened. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b2- lamaEa biyadihi, (K, TA,) and bivawobihi, (TA, S, K, &c., in art. xfq &c.,) and bisayofihi, (TA,) He signalled, or made a sign, with his hand or arm, (K, TA,) and with his garment, and with his sword; or did so for the purpose of information or warning; by raising it, and moving it about, [or waving it, or brandishing it, i. e., he waved it as a sign or signal,] in order that another might see it, and come to him; as also ↓ A^alomaEa; but the former is the more approved; [i. q. Lat. micuit;] and sometimes the verb is used without the mention of the hand or arm [&c.]. (TA.) See a verse cited voce faroDN. ― -b3- lamaEa bisayofihi, (S, and K, art. lwH,) and bivawobihi, (S, ibid, and S, K, &c., in art. xfq.) He made a sign with his sword, and with his garment, [waving it about, to make it seen by some one whom he desired to see it]. (S, K.)
4 A^alomaEa biyadihi * , &c.: see 1.

8 Ailotamasahu *
He sought, or asked, or demanded, it. (S, K.) He sought it out.

lumoEapN *
A shining, glistening, or glossy, appearance, [or hue,] of the body: (K:) any colour different from another colour [in which it is]; (TA;) [a spot of colour]. ― -b2- [Primarily] A portion of herbage beginning to dry up. (S, Msb, K.)
talaAmiyEu * : see AboriyqN in the K, and my rendering in explaining the latter word, s. v.
lamaAqN * : see EalaAqN, voce EuloqapN.

div1.div2:
ln
lano A particle denoting negation, rendering the aor. mansoob, and restricting it to the future sense: not implying corroboration of the negation, nor its never-ending continuance; though Z asserts it to imply these. (K.) [Hence lano yaDoriba signifies simply He will not beat: not he assuredly will not beat; nor he will never beat.]

div2.entryFree:
lanojarN *
An anchoring-place, a harbour, or a port, (marosFY,) for ships. (TA.) Occurring in the K art. rsw. (TA.)

laho*amN *
A sharp spear-head: see an ex. in a verse of Zuheyr, cited voce zuj~N.

lihozimapN * accord. to different authorities, app. The
angle of the lower jaw: or the ramus thereof: or the flesh upon the hinder part thereof. See maHozuwnN.

1 luhiTa bihi *
He, or it, was cast, or thrown. (TA in art. x$f.)

1 lahifa Ealayohi * , (inf. n. lahofN, S,) and ↓ talah~afa, He grieved for it, or at it; regretted it; syn. jazina and taHas~ara; (S, K;) meaning a thing that had escaped him after he been at the point of attaining it: (JK, TA:) or he grieved for it, or at it; or regretted it; and was angry, or enraged, on account of it. (TA.) But see taHas~ara; and see S, voce A^asifa. ― -b2- tlh~f signifies He felt, or expressed, grief, sorrow, or regret.
5 talah~afa see 1.

yaA lahofa *
O the grief! see an ex. in art. xTA^, conj. 4.

malohuwfN *
Greedy; ravenous; eager; EalaY or A_ilaY for a thing.

4 A^alohamahu A@ll~`hu liloxayori * [God directed him by inspiration to that which was good, or to prosperity] (TA, art. wfq) ― -b2- A^alohamahu A_iy~aAhu He suggested it to him; (in the order of the words, he suggested to him it;) he put it into his mind.
laAhum~a * and All~`hum~a: see All~`hu.

1 lahiYa Eanohu * , (S, Msb, K) and lahaA Enh (Msb, K,) He became diverted from it, so as to forget it. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b2- See an ex. voce AstA^vr: and see Eano. ― -b3- lahato A_ilaY Hadiyvihi, inf. n. lahowN and luhuw~N, She (a woman) was, or became, cheered, or delighted, and pleased, with his discourse. (M, K.) And so lahawotu biHadiyvihi. (T in art. rnw.)

4 A^alohaAniY Al$~aYo'u *
The thing diverted me; syn. $agalaniY. (Msb.) ― -b2- A^alohaAhu baAlginaA='i [He diverted him by singing]. (S, art. smd.)

5 talah~aY baAl$~aYo'i *
i. q. taEal~ala: (TA:) and A^uwliEa bihi. (Msb.) ― -b2- And tal~ihaY He diverted himself. (TA.)

lahowN *
Diversion; pastime; sport; play: or especially, such as is vain, or frivolous; idle sport: (from various explanations:) what occupies a man so as to divert him from that which would render him sad or solicitous, &c.: (TA:) or relief of the mind by means which wisdom does not require: this [it is said] is the original signification: (Et-Tarasoosee, Msb:) a thing in which a man delights himself, and which occupies him so as to divert him, and then ceases. (KT.) It has a more general application than laEibN: for ex., the hearing of musical instruments or the like is lahowN, but not laEobN. (TA.) ― -b2- A=lapu lahowK [An instrument of diversion, meaning, of music]. (K voce rabaAbN.)

lahaApN * [The uvula;] the red piece of flesh that hangs down from the upper Hanaki. (Zj, in his Khalk el-Insán.) See also AlA^asaAliqu, and $iqo$iqpN. ― -b2- AllahuAp [generally expl. as meaning The uvula: or] what is between the end of the root of the tongue and the end of the qalob [thus in all the copies of the K that I have seen, an evident mistranscription for qalot, i. e. hollow] of the upper part of the mouth (K: [app. meaning the arches, or pillars, of the soft palate; agreeably with the next explanation here following:]) or the furthest part of the mouth: [see gun~pN:] and, of the he-camel, the $iqo$iqap [i. e. bursa faucium]. (JK.) See also a usage of the pl., lahawAtN, in the last explanation of qalotN.

luhowapN *
What is thrown, [i. e. the quantity of corn that is thrown,] (S, K,) by the grinder, with his hand, (S,) into the mouth of the mill or millstone. (S, K.) And The mouth [itself] of the mill or mill-stone. (IKtt, TA; and S voce Axur~N.)

lawo * : see maSodariy~apN. ― -b2- It is used as an optative particle, lilt~aman~iY. See Kur, ii. 162; and Jel, ibid. See also kar~apN. ― -b3- lawo kaAna h`*aA lakaAna *aAka Had this been, or if this were, that had been, or would have been. ― -b4- Sal~i walawo Eajazota Eani AlqiyaAmi means [Pray thou though thou be unable to stand; i. e.] pray thou whether thou be able to stand or unable to do so. (Msb in art. An.) ― -b5- See also exs. voce A^an~a, and bal~a. ― -b6- lawo often begins a sentence ending with an aposiopesis. ― -b7- lawo meaning A^ano: see wad~a. ― -b8- lawo tusaw~aY bihimu AlA^aroDu: see bi as syn. with EalaY.
law~N * The word lawo: see a prov. cited voce *anabN (near the end of the paragraph). And see sawofa.
lawo A^an~a * [If]. Ex. lawo A^an~aka qaAy^imN laqumotu [Hadst thou been standing, I had stood]. (K, art. An.) See Kur, xxxix. 58; &c.

lawolaA * and lawomaA: see HaD~ahu. ― -b2- lawolaA faEalotu ka*aA means Wherefore didst not thou such a thing? and lawolaA tafoEalu ka*aA means Wherefore wilt not thou do such a thing? and in like manner, lawomaA and A^l~aA and hal~aA. See an ex. in the Kur, x. 98, explained in art. A_il~aA. ― -b3- lawolaA h`*aA lakaAna *aAka Had not this been, or but for this, that had been, or would have been. ― -b4- lawolaA is followed by a noun in the nom. case (as in the Kur, viii. 69), or by a verb, as in exs. above.
laAta * : see A^alata.

mulaw~aSN *
The sweet food called fAlw*: see muzaEofarN.

lawoEapN *
Ardour of love: see Hub~N.
1 maA EaAqato walaA laAfato * : see 1 in art. Ewq.
lawiqN * and lay~iqN: see EawiqN and Eay~iqN.

1 laAka *
He chewed a morsel: (S, K, Msb:) or chewed in the gentlest manner: or chewed something hard; (K;) rolling it about, or turning it round, in his mouth: (TA:) [he (a child) mumbled, or bit softly, his finger]: (S, art. mrv:) he (a horse) champed, (Msb,) or chewed, the bit. (Lth in TA, art. Alk.)
4 A^alikoniY A_ilayohi * ; and A^alakotuhu; as though from A^alaAkahu: see art. Alk.
5 maA talaw~akotu biA^aluwkK * : see A^aluwko.
1 laAma * , inf. n. lawomN, He blamed, censured, or reprehended, syn. Ea*ala, (S, M, Msb, K,) a person, (S, Msb,) EalaY ka*aA [for such a thing]. (S.)

4 A^alaAma *
He did a thing for which he should be blamed. (S in art. jnf, and L and TA in art. ryb.)

5 talaw~ama *
i. q. takal~afa All~awoma. (Ham, p. 356.)

laAy^imapN *
A thing for which the doer is blamed. (TA.)

2 law~ana *
i. q. ↓ talaw~ana It became coloured. (M.) ― -b2- It (a palm-tree) had dates which had become coloured. (T.) ― -b3- law~ana fiY AlkalaAmi [He varied in speech]. (Sgh, K, voce tamaT~aTa.)

5 talaw~ana *
It became coloured. (MA, KL.) See 1.
― -b2- It became variegated, or diversified in colour. ― -b3- And hence, (see tg~wl,) It varied in state, or condition; it was, or became, variable therein. He assumed various forms, or appearances. ― -b4- talaw~ana fulaAnN Such a one varied in disposition. (Msb.)

lawonN *
Colour: (S, Msb, K:) distinctive quality or property: (M, K:) sort, or species: (S, K:) mood, disposition, or character.
A^alowaAnu AlA^aToEimapi * [Sorts, or species, of viands]. (S in art. bA^j.)

mutalaw~inN *
Varying, or variable, in dispositions. ― -b2- Unsteady in disposition. (K.)

1 lawaY Ealayohi *
He waited for him. (Msb.) ― -b2- mar~a laA yalowiY EalaY A^aHadK He went along, not pausing nor waiting for any one. (Msb.) See the Kur-án, iii. 147. ― -b3- lawaAhu bidayonihi i. q. maTalahu. (S, Msb, K.) ― -b4- lawaY He twisted a thing; turned or wreathed it round or about: contorted it: wound it: curled it: curved it: or bent it. (K, &c.) And He, or it, turned him from his course; made him to deviate, or swerve. ― -b5- lawaY Ealayohi He went round it, or round about it. (Bd, in liii. 20.) ― -b6- lawaY Ealayohi A^amorahu [He mode his case, or affair, difficult and intricate to him: see A_ilotaw~Y Ealayohi]. (S, K, art. EwS.) ― -b7- lawaY xabarahu, (assumed tropical:) He concealed his information. (T, TA.) And lawaY A^amorahu Ein~iY (tropical:) He concealed his affair from me. (K, TA.)

4 A^alowaY biAlkalaAmi *
He distorted, wrested, or wrung, the language. (M, K.) [Hence, perhaps, fulaAnN yulowiY bixaSomihi, if the verb be correctly thus: see EuqomiYa, last sentence.]

5 talaw~aY A^lwY lwY lwy tlw tlwY tlwy
It twisted, or coiled, itself: (KL:) it became twisted, or coiled: one says, talaw~ati AlHay~apu. (MA.) ― -b2- talaw~aY mino wajaEi AlD~arobi [He writhed by reason of the pain of beating]. (M, A, K, art. Dwr.)
6 yatalAawayaAni * said of two serpents [They twist together]: see EaqAamN, last sentence.

8 AilotawaY * , neuter verb, It twisted: wound: bent. (K, &c.) ― -b2- AilotawaY Ealayohi It (an affair) became difficult; or difficult and intricate. (TA.) ― -b3- Alotawato EalaY~a HaAjatiY My want became difficult of attainment. (TA.) ― -b4- AltwY Ealayohi also He acted, or behaved, perversely towards him.

liwaA='N *
A banner, or standard, syn. EalamN, (M, Mgh, K,) of a commander, (T,) or of an army, less than the raAyap, being a strip of cloth, twisted, or wound, and tied to a spear-shaft. (Mgh.) See rifaAdapN. Respecting the liwaA=' of the Kaabeh, see sadana and faAdapN.
saw~aA='N law~aA='N * : see art. swY.
All~awaA * occurs in poetry for All~awaAtiY. (TA in art. $rf.)

A^alowaY *
Very contentious. (K.) See an ex. voce musotamar~.
A^alayosa * : see the latter part of art. A^alaA.
1 laAga * , aor. yalaAgu, inf. n. layagN: see an ex. in a verse cited voce tazan~ada.

liyfN * [The membranous fibres that grow at the base of the branches of the palm-tree:] the best sort is the lyf of the cocoa-nut. (TA.) See $ariyEN. ― -b2- liyfN is used by Ibn-Mukbil as meaning (assumed tropical:) A she-camel's tail. (TA in arts. $*b and $ml.)

1 maA yaliyqu bihi *
It is not suitable to him, does not befit him, that he should do such a thing. (Msb.)
layokaA * , [i. e. layoka with an adjunct alif for the sake of the rhyme,] for A_ilayoka: see art. A_ilaY, near the end.

layolN * : see nahaArN. ― -b2- banaAtu All~ayoli Wishes: (T, TA in art. bnY:) and anxieties. (TA ibid.) ― -b3- Aibonu All~ayoli The thief, or robber: (T in art. bnY:) and the wayfarer, or traveller. (Er-Rághib in TA in that art.) ― -b4- A^axuw All~ayoli A nightfarer: see a verse cited voce Eadasa.

layolapN *
A night-journey, or night's journey. ― -b2- raA^ayotu All~ayolapa fiY manaAmiY; and kaAna ka*aA waka*aA All~ayolapa; and maA A^a$obaha All~ayolapa biAlbaAriHaho: see above, p. 183 a.

A^um~u layolaY *
Wine: layolaY signifying Aln~a$owapu. (T in art. Am.)
layoliY~N * : see nahirN.
layaAlK * is pl. of layolaApN. (TA, voce A^aroDN.)

1 laAna * , inf. n. liynN [not layonN as in the CK] and layAanN, (T, S, M, K,) contr. of xa$una; (S, K in art. x$n, and TK;) It was, or became, soft, as opposed to rough or harsh; smooth; plain; without asperities; fine to the touch; delicate; tender; supple; lithe; limber; pliant; pliable; flexible; ductile; malleable; soft, or flabby; lax: and he was, or became, soft; tender; pliant; gentle; bland; or mild. Hence lAn jaAnibuhu: see lay~inN. ― -b2- laAna baTonuhu His bowels became relaxed. ― -b3- laAna He relented.

3 laAyanahu biAlqawoli *
He soothed, coaxed, or wheedled, him with words. (L, art. msH.) ― -b2- laAyanahu [He acted gently towards him; (M, K;) treated him with gentleness, or blandishment; soothed him; coaxed him; wheedled him;] i. q. daAraAhu. (S, M, Msb, voce dArAh.) ― -b3- laAyanahu He was soft, tender, gentle, bland, or mild, towards him. (M, K.)
4 A^alaAna baTonahu * [It relaxed his bowels]; said of medicine. (K in art. shl.)
10 AisotalaAna * : see its contr. Astx$n.
laAna * for AloA=na: see the latter in art. Ayn.

liynu AlEayo$i *
Softness, delicateness, or easiness, of life.
liynapN * applied to a palm-tree: see art. lwn; and see EajowapN.

Eayo$N lay~inN *
Soft, delicate, or easy, life. ― -b2- lay~inu AljaAnibi: see jaAnibN. ― -b3- lay~inu AlA^aEoTaAfi; &c.: see art. ETf.

mulay~inN *
A lenitive, or laxative, medicine.
laAhi A^anota * : and AlHamodu laAhi: and lAahum~a: see All~`hu, and art. lyh in the S; and see an ex. of laAhum~a voce $aAdixapN.
